title: Introducing: Grudle Bay Riots
content:
I seem to have become something of an obsessive of the Oxford music scene recently.

It all started unassumingly with those loveable pop tykes Alphabet Backwards, a band I really shouldn’t like but really kind of do, who in turn introduced me to the mighty Spring Offensive, easily one of my favourite musical discoveries of the year. And now I find myself sniffing around Grudle Bay Riots, or Abingdon-based duo Nathan Allsworth and Tom Hodges. The pair function as the linchpin of a fluid musical collective – occasionally they might be joined by Alphabet drummer Paul Davidson, Winchell Riots (oh look, another ace Oxford band…) sticksman James Pamphlion, drum machinist (and sibling) James Allsworth, or keyboardist Tom Dyson. In any case, new track Fool Around marries understated glitch to some gorgeous delay antics, by way of a soulful, chilled out vocal. I’m seriously looking forward to more output from these guys, and hopefully after hearing Fool Around, you will be too.

Fool Around- Live from the bedroom by Grudle Bay
